It also protects against unequal treatment based on reproductive healthcare and autonomy.\nA YES vote puts these protections in the New York State Constitution.\nA NO vote leaves these protections out of the State Constitution.[7]”']","# Ballot for Dutchess County, New York
## New York Proposal 1, Equal Protection of Law Amendment (2024)

“This proposal would protect against unequal treatment based on ethnicity, national origin, age, disability, and sex, including sexual orientation, gender identity and pregnancy. It also protects against unequal treatment based on reproductive healthcare and autonomy.
A YES vote puts these protections in the New York State Constitution.
A NO vote leaves these protections out of the State Constitution.[7]”

# Ballot for Dutchess County, New York
## New York Proposal 1, Equal Protection of Law Amendment (2024)

“This proposal would protect against unequal treatment based on ethnicity, national origin, age, disability, and sex, including sexual orientation, gender identity and pregnancy. It also protects against unequal treatment based on reproductive healthcare and autonomy.
A YES vote puts these protections in the New York State Constitution.
A NO vote leaves these protections out of the State Constitution.[7]”
*This report provides an AI-assisted analysis of ballot complexity. Please note that this is a supplementary analysis and not a substitute for official election information.*

# Ballot for Putnam County, New York
## New York Proposal 1, Equal Protection of Law Amendment (2024)

“This proposal would protect against unequal treatment based on ethnicity, national origin, age, disability, and sex, including sexual orientation, gender identity and pregnancy. It also protects against unequal treatment based on reproductive healthcare and autonomy.
A YES vote puts these protections in the New York State Constitution.
A NO vote leaves these protections out of the State Constitution.[7]”
